properties.areaDesc: St. Clair; Huron; Bay; Tuscola; Sanilac
properties.headline: Lakeshore Flood Warning issued January 11 at 3:36PM EST until January 12 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Detroit/Pontiac MI
properties.description:
* WHAT...Significant lakeshore flooding expected.

* WHERE...Bay, Huron, Tuscola, Sanilac and St. Clair Counties.

* WHEN...Until 10 AM EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Numerous roads closed and low lying property
including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure
may be inundated near the lake. Intensified shoreline erosion
will occur.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong northeast winds will persist through
tonight. This onshore flow produces high waves and rising water
levels resulting in significant shoreline flooding. Low lying
areas along Saginaw Bay will be particularly susceptible to
flooding as the water level is forecast to peak near 74 inches
above chart datum at Essexville tonight. There is also potential
for flooding to extend up the Saginaw River into Bay City.
properties.instruction:
If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be
closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of
unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone
property.

NWSheadline: LAKESHORE FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SUNDAY
